TopicTitle: Crash upon loading into VAB and/or SPH

Articles.Content:
Ok, so this bug is weird... it only crashes sometimes when loading into the editor, and the log files don’t seem to report any one obvious error. (I forgot to take screenshots of the log, so I’ll post them here later when it crashes again.)

Here is the crash screen


 

And my modlist (only 40 or so mods... should be easy to pick through )


I’m sure I’ll accidentally solve this by deleting mods and such, but if anyone can help in the meantime that would be great!

Edited April 17, 2021 by Daedalus3000
Wrong modlist doi!

68 mods . Might be a mod but sounds memory related. What’s the specs of your pc/laptop? Easiest thing first is to rule out the basics so I would verify files through steam and check all mods are up to date (although looks like you use ckan). Then you have a clean point to start from. Unfortunately i sense some mod removal being required in the near future, sorry.

I put the wrong modlist lol, but I’m fine with removing mods if necessary 

as for specs I have a:

Nvidia GeForce 950m gpu (2gb video card)

I have 16 gigs of ram (says only 11 gigs available dont know if that’s normal, I just have mc, valorant, and 2 copies of ksp.)

Intel i7-4720HQ @2.60 GHz

and I’m on windows if that matters.

Also played Beyond home recently and used these mods without a problem:


 

As for verifying files... I kind of hid this install from steam by renaming and moving it (so steam doesn’t auto-update or any weirdness), so how would I make it visible to steam again?

Edited April 17, 2021 by Daedalus3000

Ok it’s not your pc specs then...

9 hours ago, Daedalus3000 said:

As for verifying files... I kind of hid this install from steam by renaming and moving it (so steam doesn’t auto-update or any weirdness), so how would I make it visible to steam again

It might be to do with this. There might be a mod that’s been hard coded to look for the original path and of course it’s different on yours.

You would need to put everything back in the original steam directory to get steam to access it.

There is a far easier way of blocking steam. 1st, go into steam and make sure auto updates are turned off for KSP. Then go into your KSP folder and there is an .exe called “ksp_x64” in there which basically runs a steam free version. Send that to desktop and delete the original steam one (from the desktop) and steam won’t even know you’re playing.

Without a log file, this will always be a blind guess and pure luck to find a solution.  Please run the game until it crashes, then upload the log file for us. If you are not familiar with the logs, please take a look at this thread:

It contains all information about the location of the log file(s).

12 hours ago, Daedalus3000 said:

As for verifying files... I kind of hid this install from steam by renaming and moving it (so steam doesn’t auto-update or any weirdness), so how would I make it visible to steam again?

You can either move the whole game files back into the original steam directory or just download a fresh copy of the game and copy and replace the fresh files with the files of your modded game. Or copy mods and savegames into the fresh install, both will work

 

2 hours ago, FruitGoose said:

There might be a mod that’s been hard coded to look for the original path and of course it’s different on yours.

That would be such a rookie mistake, I hope that's no mod creator would ever fall for

 

2 hours ago, FruitGoose said:

1st, go into steam and make sure auto updates are turned off for KSP.

How would you do that? AFAIK they disabled that option years ago so the only alternative you have is setting the game to "update at game launch" and then never launch it through steam but I would love to be proven wrong

I verified my files through steam last night (I just renamed it Kerbal Space Program and snuck it back to the steamapps/common folder), but haven't played it yet (it was late last night.) Hopefully that fixed it! (it said it added 50 files or something like that) If not I'll just do the remove half of my mods remove the other half strategy untill it works.

42 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:

How would you do that? AFAIK they disabled that option years ago so the only alternative you have is setting the game to "update at game launch" and then never launch it through steam but I would love to be proven wrong

Yeah ill just do that,  but if I hide it from steam again will the verify files things still have any meaning? (best phrasing ever) 

45 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:

That would be such a rookie mistake, I hope that's no mod creator would ever fall for

I suspect Nertea lol... seems like the kind of rookie modmaker that would do that .

Edited April 17, 2021 by Daedalus3000

1 hour ago, 4x4cheesecake said:

How would you do that? AFAIK they disabled that option years ago so the only alternative you have is setting the game to "update at game launch" and then never launch it through steam but I would love to be proven wrong

Yes you are right, but setting it to that (along with "never allow downloads while I'm playing") shows "Auto-Updates Disabled" on the "downloads" screen. Having said that, I'm not sure if starting the game would in fact override that so as you say, the fact you're playing outside of Steam will stop it anyway. Basically you don't want it set to the other 2 options though as it may update whenever you open Steam for something else.

It seems to be working fine now thanks guys!

 (due to the nature of this glitch though it may reapear soon and I've just been lucky for the past hour of playing.)

2 hours ago, FruitGoose said:

Yes you are right, but setting it to that (along with "never allow downloads while I'm playing") shows "Auto-Updates Disabled" on the "downloads" screen. Having said that, I'm not sure if starting the game would in fact override that so as you say, the fact you're playing outside of Steam will stop it anyway. Basically you don't want it set to the other 2 options though as it may update whenever you open Steam for something else.

Hm...interesting. I have to try that
